review: 100% Awesome experience! Say at the bar after a day of traveling from Iowa. Tony was the bartender. OUTSTANDING SERVICE! Menu in the first 5 seconds, drink order in the next 10 seconds... never took attention off of customers even though he was SWAMPED! He checked on my order multiple times keeping me updated.  Food was delicious and was left full and satisfied. I don't give out 5s often but this was just perfect!

My kids love Red Robin and it is a place that I don't mind going to occasionally. It was a busy Friday night and our party of 2 adults and 3 kids were seated in about 25 minutes.  Our server was prompt, grabbing all of our drinks and appetizers. The kids always want cherries on their sprite and he gladly got them, which I 100% appreciate as a mom.  Our food was good, everything was exactly as we ordered.  My four year old requested and was given an empty box after he tripped and spilled his in the parking lot. It really is the small things that people do that make a huge difference when I am out with my kids.  My only regret is that I can not remember our servers name.

It was decent. Super busy on a Saturday night but amazingly was able to seat our huge party at 5:30pm. The food was your typical fast casual sit down restaurant. Nothing special. Honestly a little over priced for the generic and lack luster burgers. The service was great though. Very attentive and quick to get us drinks and refills.

Dylan our server was amazing tonight! He was slammed and still made sure we were happy! We had such a great time after a seriously hard day! So I really appreciate his hard work and friendliness!  Go Dylan!

Use to have such great service but it's completely gone down hill! We placed an order ToGo over the phone and they didn't even put the order though! They are using a 3rd party system now & THEY SUCK! The manager FINALLY came by after talking on the phone to see where our order was & came to put a ticket into the kitchen. This was 30 minuets after I had been waiting in the lobby for my original pickup time! They gave us 25% off our ticket but If I were a manager I would have been more generous since it's clearly their fault. Service needs a revamp!

Ordered online. My hamburger was well done, no mayo or ketchup. Forgot the fries totally. Ordered seafood platter, it had no tarter or cocktail sauce. Forgot the extra fries. This was the 3rd disappointing meal from Red Robin's. So lost our business.

Could've been way better. We started off with a really nice guy as our waiter but he left quickly and was replaced with two girls who really could've been more professional. Maybe next time they could not through our items on the table and just rush off.

Ignored too long and walked out. I'm writing this from their parking lot while deciding on a restaurant with good service.  Three employees walked by, and the one at the podium at the entrance just ignored me while typing on a device.  I read the other poor service reviews, and they are correct.

I had to leave a review because of my entire experience last night at Red Robin. First of all, all the staff were very friendly and welcoming and talked to me as my fiancé and I were waiting for a table. Our server, Andi, was one of the nicest people I've ever met and she engaged in actual conversation with us instead of just wanting to know our order. She found out that I was in the military before and we talked a little about that. She left to go put our order in and the manager, Jesús, came out and shook my hand and thanked me for my service and talked a little with me too. It was very nice of them to do that because they didn't have to. The burgers and fries were good as usual there, but their customer service made me want to write this so here I am. Thanks Andi and Jesús for giving my fiancé and I a wonder date night!

Consistent with other RRs. Quick, friendly, and consistent food fishes, however loud audibly and visually! Also, a bit overpriced for what you get, but again, when you're on the road and want something consistent that makes the kids happy gets the nod. We wouldn't go out of our way, but if it's easy, we'd return.
Just had another great burger. Tried the Southern Charm Burger. Have to say it is now my favorite burger. I highly suggest trying this burger! The service was very good too!
The food is amazing, but the wait is sometimes unbearable especially while waiting for food you'll finish two glasses before you get anything.
Stopped in for lunch on a business trip. Sat in the bar. Quick friendly service.  I will definitely be back! Overall has a good experience!
Please take the tablet off of the tables, it ruins family dinners. Otherwise the food was good and service was okay. Nothing amazing but worth the money. Manager is very nice!

My friend and I arrived at 11 am to avoid the lunch crowd and were seated almost immediately.  The food was as we have both come to expect and we were quite pleased.   The SERVICE was a different story though.  The food came fairly promptly, no complaints, however the side of Ranch I requested was, quite literally, thrown at me as the waitress rushed passed our table to parts unknown.  Not wanting to make a big deal about it, I did not say anything, when the refill for my sweet potato fries came though, not only were they HUGE, were nearly tossed at the table as well.  Since I did not recognize the young lady waiting on our table I could think of no reason for her obvious desire to avoid our table as the lunch crowd still had not arrived before we left.  I hope she learns to put her customers first if she plans on earning decent tips in the future.

Service was great! The server told me all my gluten free options I enjoyed a burger gluten free bun, gluten free fries and a gluten free beer. I will be back soon. It so nice to go out and have a great meal.

Went today for lunch with some family. Our 2 year old daughter ran around like a wild Banshee, luckily there were not many people in our general area. Food was decent had a new burger with pork on top and jalepeno corn bread bun. Will go back especially when they have buy one get one half off deals
Five stars for friendliness and service. Great appetizers and bar menu. I had boneless wings with buzz sauce one word Awesome. Thank you Jamie you were very accommodating and pleasant.
Pros: great service, bar tender one of the most efficient I've seen. Decent prices. Cons: bottomless fries, uhhhhggg I ate too much!

Food wasn't that good. Long wait time. Advised by hostess to address an issue with the manager which she felt was wrong too. When we addressed it with him he was unprofessional and had an oh well kind of attitude. They forgot to put our loyalty card in even after we provided it. Highly disappointed... since we've always had a wonderful experience at the Woodland Red Robin friendly employees, superior service and great food.

A group of close family friends and I just left this place 15 minutes ago, and service was awesome! We were camping at Shasta for the weekend and wanted to eat at a restaurant before we all parted ways.  We all had our dogs with us, and they let us take over the outdoor seating area with our dogs. The service was consistently good from beginning to end, and we definitely had a great time! Kendra was our main waitress, and was very sweet and accomodating. The restaurant was busy due to the holiday, but they remembered to check on us often and made sure we had everything we need.

Love the service and the food. Great hamburger restaurant to go to, as they have different varieties of hamburgers. The fries are really great as well, and like how you can get seconds. I also like the atmosphere in the restaurant though it can get pretty loud sometimes, but its good.

This review is about David. He's the best. My boyfriend and I come here fairly often and he remembers our favorite orders and always gets it right. He's fast and on top of it!  He's basically the unicorn of Red Robin. No one can compete! Give him all the tips.

The  remodel worked...I always order at the bar..see Jamie for the best drinks and service!!! Summertime is busy , but the service is excellent. Now for the food...They have the second best burger in Redding...I make the best!!! I do however recommend the Southern Charm Burger...For anyone that craves grilled onions and and bacon!!!

What happened to Red Robin? I ordered online, order was supposed to be ready at 6:01, got there at 6:06 to make sure it was ready because I had a special place to be ( reason for ordering online) go up to the bar-nope can't get it there anymore you have to go through the person in the front.. So I waited IN LINE there, as everyone got seated then find out my order wasn't even ready yet. Finally got my food and was able to leave a full half hour after it was supposed to be ready.. Wow thanks missed the special engagement, can't get that back.  The manager was nice enough to take off 25%(still not confirmed) but still, money isn't the issue.  the whole purpose for calling in an order or ordering online is so you don't wait in the lines.  Well not at Red Robin tonight.
Awesome food and service.  The guacamole burger is the bomb.  Bottomless steak fries... need I say more.

Well, I've been a fan of RR for many years. Their food is consistently good for the most part. During this visit, 10/21/15, was no exception. The food was good! This review however is about our server Candace. To date, she has been the BEST server we have had. She was full of energy, funny, beyond proficient, and just served with a genuine smile.  Since RR is a chain, their food is regulated by the company. The workers are also trained to do certain things a certain way but what Candace did and how she did them was beyond I have seen and experience in a long time.  Great job Candace!  You are awesome!  Thank you for being a highlight of our evening.

So sad the kind of service that a small group of senior received today. The waitress was extremely rude as if she really didn't want to be at work or wait on them. One woman received the wrong burger only to be told by the waitress that is not what she ordered even after multiple people heard her order.  The directors order was wrong, he got a very runny egg on a burger when he asked for it hard. He informed the waitress who said she would get him another one, mind you the yolk had saturated the burger at this point.  Approx. 10 minutes later she brings out a hard cooked egg, an egg for his yolk covered cold burger. He explained to the waitress     ( who got pissy) that he didn't want his burger, she sent out a manager. He explained it to the manager who said they would make a new one only by that time they were all ready to leave. Now this wouldn't have been such a big deal except for the rude service that all 10 of them received. The residents wont be back and you can bet the other 90 people they live with and their families will all hear about it.

Service was very slow for a weeknight and they appeared to be understaffed as the food took a long time too. We ordered the Boca veggie burger and fries. The burger was over cooked and lacked overall flavor, but of course the fries were delicious lol :) Will go back in the future, but they did not knock by socks off and I've had better.
Very good service in the bar area. Cold beer and their food is fresh and comes out fast.

I haven't visited a Red Robin in several years because I had a mediocre experience in Illinois at a couple of them. But yesterday I had a business meeting at Red Robin in Redding. I have completely changed my opinion of this restaurant chain based on that experience. First the host, Kurt, was exceptionally friendly. Second, the waitress we had, Heidi, had the most pleasant and inviting countenance and manner about her that we truly enjoyed the entire meal and every interaction.  I ordered fish (can you believe that at a burger place?) and it was actually better than most places. So I highly recommend the fish and chips.   Overall, I honestly have no idea how they could have done a better job. This restaurant is at the top of my list now. Thank you for making my business meeting excellent yesterday! Red Robin rocks!

I don't go out much now I'm retired.  When I want a tasty burger and a beer I go to Red Robin. I've been here a dozen times and eat at the bar so I can watch sports while I eat. Tony has worked here for 14 years. He is an excellent bartender and always in a great mood. He keeps a clean bar. I worked in restaurants and look at little things. Tony is on point all the time. The orders have never been messed up. He works with his team well. The Guacamole bacon cheeseburger is my favorite and their onion rings are the best in Redding. Creamy and nicely breaded.  Onion rings, a big beer and Guac burger was 21 bucks. It satisfied me like a steak.  They make good burgers and have good beer with excellent service.

Sat in the bar area and Shannon (our server) was very pleasant & gave us fast, professional service!  I had the Burnin' Love Burger and it was sooo delicious. I've ordered it at other Red Robins and never had the Whole Roasted Jalapeño on top..awesome! Had Onion Rings instead of fries (thx to our server's suggestion) and it was perfection on a plate! My Hubby had the Chili Burger and said it was "just good" but loved his "endless" Sweet Potato Fries! Our dining experience was very satisfying .. We will definitely be back!

We chose to go to Red Robin for my free birthday burger, which I chose to be the Uber burger because it sounds big. Upon eating Uber burger I discovered that I really enjoyed cheese infused with beer, as well as Canadian bacon even though it's actually just ham. They also put sausages on it that were of German descent but those are actually just hot dogs with fancy casings, but still really good. After inhaling uber burger, while eating my second basket of bottomless steak fries, and reflecting on what it will be like to deal with my first heart attack the waitress came over and told me some startling news. She apparently had neglected to realize and take note of the fact that the uber burger was so Uber that it was a specialty burger and not just a burger for the masses. So the birthday discount would not apply to the master race of hamburgers.  She was nice enough to call the manager whose name was Michelle who also seems like a very nice person since she took the price of the burger off the bill, as it was noticeably their mistake that they were willing to rectify and correction quickly. and I said rectify not erectify, its not that kind of restaurant. In closing I will / most likely return to Red Robin for future free meals as that is what birthdays and America are all about.

I love this place this prices are a little pricey but I think its worth it. The food is amazing and they have such a huge variety of burgers and you can't go wrong with bottomless fries, sweet potatoes or broccoli. There appetizers are good also have good margaritas can't complain!!!! They even have a section if your trying to watch your calories

This is a really good place for hamburgers! We love the quality of the burgers and the unlimited fries. I got the smoke and bacon which was really good. Nice meat and big burgers. Employees are nice and friendly.

I have always loved Red Robin since they give many gluten free options that are lacking in Redding. I am extremely disappointed by my service today. Not only was there service extremely slow, though it was crowded, but they also got orders wrong. Our water was never refilled and our waiter stood watching us count out cash to pay the bill. To top it all off my gluten free burger had pasta in it, if I had not noticed I would have gotten extremely sick. When I told a hostess she said she would get the manager since that was a big deal, I wish I would not have done that, she was extremely condescending and acted as if it shouldn't have been an issue. I will continue to frequent Red Robin for the options they allow me but I cannot express my disappointment enough.

This used to be the spot to be when I used to live in Redding, that was about seven years ago now and it's much better than it was then. They rebranded and redid their interiors.  The food is good and they still have tons of pictures on the wall's and on the ceiling.

Gosh I used to love this place. It seems it's gone down hill the last few times.  Pretzel bites were burnt on the outside, not done on the inside. The cheese was burnt on top.  The fries were hard as a rock and tasted microwaved.  The burgers were charcoaled and dry. Buns were stale. Just overall disappointing.
Was seated in the red tables, its like getting seated with someone else's family. Don't see how they thought this was even remotely close to a good idea.
I love this RED ROBIN!!! Always excellent service!!!! Managers are always floating around just making sure everything is amazing!
Well it's been awhile since coming to Red  Robin. Yeah not much better than your local BK or MC Donald's. The brainiacs can't even get a simple burger order right. Yeah not good at all

We normally don't eat at chain restaurants, but Red Robin has some pretty tasty burgs and is our go-to place every now and then.  We ordered takeout tonight, my husband's burger was correct.  I wanted my burger without salsa (Burnin' Love burger), and I wanted to substitute my fries for onion rings for a small extra cost.  If I'm going salty, I'm going all the way.  Not only did they slather the burger with salsa to the point where I couldn't scrape it off, it was infused in EVERTHING, but instead of onion rings they put a heaping mound of onion straws, which are not the same thing at all.   My husband's burger is going to be reheated in the oven as I type this since he graciously went back to get the correct order.   After working in the service industry, I always expect the to-go person to open each box and repeat the order, which only takes a minute and leaves the customer feeling secure instead of having them drive back and get the correct order.  Please don't make us go elsewhere, Red Robin!

This is a very late review, but better late then never. I would really like to give a shoutout to Kimberley that works at the Redding, CA branch location. She is very sweet and very good at making a busy day seem like nothing to the customers that come in to eat. When we entered, we were told it was going to be a ten minute wait and we only waited about 5. When seated, Kim came over to get our drink order and paid attention to us without making us feel rushed. I appreciate the friendliness she offered and efficiency, even on a slammed day at a slammed hour. She's a keeper and I hope she knows her value. Also, the food was amazing. Too much as usual; I always take a doggy bag home. And the Bottomless Strawberry Lemonade is always the best part of our visit.

Ordered a simple grilled chicken sandwich, nothing crazy, minus pickles and onion, with broccoli on the side. Came out with strangely dry looking chicken breast between two toasted buns and lettuce and tomato on the side. The broccoli was taking a little more time to steam apparently. So I start eating my sandwich and it's what you would expect a frozen chicken breast to taste like. Broccoli comes out finally, smallest portion no bigger than a fist, keep in mind this cost extra. It looks like they took packaged broccoli out this morning to let it defrost, then let it sit out all day to dry out, then steamed it back to its pathetic life. It was rubbery tough and disgusting. It also came with its very own brown rotten interior, you have to actually put effort into making broccoli that shitty. Thank you for the $10 meal it was very memorable.
Never got our bottomless fries. Our waitress was not one I want again. Burgers were oj

Incredibly disappointing for 4 burgers, root beer float, soda, freckle lemonade, and alcoholic shake (eww) at $60. Server was awesome. Burgers tasted  like cafeteria food. Didn't look like real beef. Bottomless fries only after you have like a handful. The buns were dry and when you went to hold them they fell apart. Will find somewhere else to celebrate family events for sure.
Nice change with multiple TV. Gonna try the Blue Burger with Ghost Sauce. Bartenders and servers have a great attitude. They now serve bottomless Sweet Potato Fries or Broccoli now. Yummy!!!!

I love this place. The food is always excellent and the waiters are always friendly and helpful. The pictures and decorations are so unique and always end up starting conversations. Their adult drinks are a bit strong for my taste but their freckled lemonade is to die for. It's rare that I get a soda there.

The food is awesome, as it always has been. My complaint is the new tablets they have at all the tables. Ever since they got those the customer service is nonexistent. It took me two hours to get out of there and it was only me and my date. They just ignore you and when you do get their attention it's a one shot deal before they disappear forever. When it came time to pay I wanted to pay in cash but they never came back to my table. I ended up having to pay on my card because it's what I could do on the tablet from my table... After my last visit I was not impressed.

Red Robin proclaims itself as the burger authority and I would agree. A great range of burger styles to choose from, as well as bottomless fries to ensure you will always get your fill. There is Fast Food and then there is food that is fast, this location has friendly staff, cleanly facilities, quality food as well as expedient  service. Another strong link in this chain of restaurants; they most certainly hold to a high standard and it can be seen and tasted.

Had not been in a Red Robin for some time and remembered why after this visit. It is loud in this restaurant, be prepared to have to lean way in to have a conversation, it felt like one big birthday party.  Everyone in the building must have had a birthday and when they sing since it is so loud in the building the singers all shout to be heard, too much. I remember Red Robin making decent food, but the Ensenada Chicken dish they serve could have been from yesterday held in the window. The chicken breast was flat and very dry, it looked much better in the photo album they call a menu. The salad was boring, all iceberg, big chunks of core and the dressing very flavorless. My ears were ringing by the time we got outside the building, won't be coming back for a while unless it is my birthday and I need to be shouted at.

We come here frequently but the past few times the service has been way less than the usual great quality and the food has been WAY less than exceptional. Our fries were served cold and mine looked like they had been sitting for quite some time before they were served. Even the second baskets of fries that were brought out to us were luke warm at best. When we are paying extra for the sweet potato fries my husband loves so much, it's disappointing for them to be served cold. No part of our meal was the usual fresh tasting quality the past three times we have came in. We love Red Robin but unfortunately will not be back for a while.

I am giving RR 4 stars for what they are: an Applebee's style Burger chain. We don't often eat this type of food (very high-calorie, lots of deep fried options) however when my father in law suggested we take him there for dinner my husband and I were happy to oblige. We had the Poutine  (french fries covered in gravy and cheese curds, a Canadian favourite and very tasty), the chicken wings and onion rings as appetizers. All of the above were yummy and came with sauces, again VERY filling. After the appetizers all I could eat was a side salad while the guys ordered burgers. The burgers looked good but seemed a bit steep in price (about $12.00).  Overall a fun place to eat, they have also done some recent upgrades on the exterior and the menu. Don't expect the prices to be In N Out though, because they are steeper. I would recommend looking at the online menu before going to ensure this is what you're looking for.  Overall, nice staff, fairly short wait times, and what you'd expect from a chain burger restaurant.  Maybe bring some tums for after ;)

Small burgers for the price but very tasty.  It has been almost seven years since we were last here(because of the cost of a plate for what you get) it could be a while before we return again. The service is great. A loud atmosphere.

I have been to the Redding, CA  Red Robin at least fifteen times in the past two years.  The food quality and service has been less that stellar during our last three visits.  My family had two burgers and two salads during our Most recent visit.  The burgers were dry and overcooked  and the salads were not very fresh.  A real bummer AS this was one of our favorite restaurants in Redding.

Been here a couple times lately and had a server named John. He is wonder! Really funny, nice, and quick. Food is the best, I love the burgers! Drinks are yummy too. Love to have ladies night here! They get a group of 6 in pretty fast. Yumm!!!

If you're going to stop here...don't. Go to the In N Out down the street and I'm sure the service and food will be better. An order of fries with your burger equal 5 individual fries. Also stay away from what they call "salad" which is pretty much white pieces of what I can only assume are lettuce. Forget about getting any attention from your server, she was too busy eating in the back and would come back to the table chewing. After we asked for our bill, we literally stood up for 10 minutes waiting and ended up throwing cash on the table and walking out. What a waste.

Atmosphere is always kid friend and food is good but wait times have continually gotten longer and longer over the past couple of months. My kids love this place so hopefully the time to order to get food become a little speedier. Average time the last 3-4 times we have been has been 20 to 35 min. Food is always good !

Been here three times, and three times have found the food to be good, but the service SUCKS!!!!! Server was more of a ghost than the ghost pepper sauce on my burger. Endless fries...nothing but lies! I will never be back. I do have to add that the manager, Daniel was very apologetic and quite nice. My only advice to him is to get rid of the dead weight and get some servers that care. If I could have, I would have left a tip of - $5.00. Yes...that is a negative 5!!!!
I am not going anymore. the burgers get smaller and more expensive every time I go there. Thank goodness for all you can eat fries or I would not be full

Looked really nice on the outside. Once we stepped in - first noticeable thing was dirty carpets. Who keeps carpets in a restaurant? They were just horrible, with crumbs and stuff all over. The food was decent though. Also they had weird on-table kiosk systems that nobody seemed to use!?

I'm not going to comment on the food.  This place is dirty.  The dividing walls are dusty. The poles above the dividers are sticky. The seats are black on the top and edges encrusted with food items. The baseboards are caked with black gunk.  The table seemed clean so I guess that's okay. With such a huge operation I wonder why they can't afford a cleaning service? Update. I got food poisoning from the lettuce. Never. Again.

The food was what I expected I suppose. The hamburger I ordered was okay. The fries were a bit cold and over salted though. Another concern.. I payed at the table using their touch screen with a card, the next day I has fraudulent charges. Due to the seldom nature that I use it and the 2 previous transactions, I'm pretty sure it was a result of using that machine. I've ruled out many ways my info could have gotten out before assuming this btw.
3 stars for endless fries (that's what my husband says)!! Quick service, decent food and friendly people.

Red Robin has always been the go to place for me & my kids. Not anymore. My last 3 visits we've had bad service & I do NOT like the iPad system. My most recent visit was on January 23. We waited 15 minutes before our waitress ever visited our table. She took our appetizer & drink orders on the iPad because I refuse to do that myself. This is why I go out to eat and why I tip my waitress, for the service. Our drinks and appetizers came out in a timely manner, but we were done with our drinks and appetizers and she still had not taken our dinner order. Our waitress never came around or refilled our drinks, we had to find someone and ask them to bring her to our table so we could get a refill on our drinks. In the end, we were there for 90 minutes (not counting the time we waited for our table) 90 minutes for a burger. We sat down at 5:54 & finished at 7:30. I also do NOT like that I have to pay my bill myself. Again, waitressing is a service industry. I'm paying/tipping for a service. Unfortunately the service at this red robin has gone downhill. I even selected that I wished for a representative to email me about my visit because I was unhappy. I've never from them.
Yum!  Good food at decent price.  Happy all around =)

My husband got food poisoning, and what's worse is that the food really isn't very good. Lots of fat on the bacon, the burgers were unimpressive and the fries are not crisp. Also the garlic fries don't even taste like garlic. Save yourself the many bathroom trips and go somewhere else.

The customer service was off the chain. I ordered a pink burger and I got it overdone but it was no problem, I just had the server change it,  no biggy. The manager comes out and says sorry the burger was over cooked and said he took it off the bill! Without me complaining! WELCOME BACK TO AMERICA! That was what we believed in at one time in this country, costumer service and returning customers. God bless America!

Stopped by on a Saturday night and it was quite busy, it was also prom night. There was quite an amount of people outside waiting for a table but we didn't wait for any longer than 15 minutes. We sat down and our server David was very friendly. My brothers ordered a kids Mac and cheese and the other ordered the kids fish and chips. They gave accidentally gave us two Mac and cheeses and David and the manager apologized and got the fish and chips out right away. Overall the food and service was great.

My friend treated Tony and I to lunch here! The All American cuisine was delicious! We started with a big stack of onion rings. There wee gluten  free options for $ 1 more. The sauces are fun... Only  50 cents for additional sauces so it's fun to try them out! I had a delicious burger, my friend had prime rib on a hoagie and Tony had the fish and chips. All were large portions and lots of ways to make the meal special for your tastes.

Took my boyfriend here for his first time on a Saturday afternoon and it was BUSY! After our lunch, we understood why. We ended up getting a nice booth in the corner of the bar without waiting for a table in the dining room, and was greeted almost immediately by Meredith.  Throughout our lunch Meredith never stopped moving. She was taking care of half the bar, and never failed to provide excellent service to all her guests.  The food was amazing (we had a couple drinks and burgers) and we were very pleased with the service.  This place can be loud but it's worth it if you want quality burgers, bottomless fries, great drinks and amazing service. Try to ask for Meredith if you can, she's the best!

I've tried this location out a few times. The food really isn't that great, unfortunately. The last time I went, I had a front row seat to an employee's temper tantrum. Although I found it amusing, I don't think other families around me appreciated it.

I'm not typically a fan of chain restaurants but I have a soft spot for Red Robin.  They never disappoint and are always consistent. They have tasty burgers and those bottomless steak fries are irresistible.  For those times that I feel ok about wolfing down over 1,000 calories in one sitting, we come here.  Recently discovered the Salted Caramel Milkshake. I can kiss any chance of a flat stomach goodbye.

Today when my friend and I went there we ha ants crawling on our table, when we asked to move we saw a huge cockroach crawling across the floor. The manager just said "yea I know, I've put in a call about it".. Alongside the seats in between the windows and seats, is filthy. How about instead of a call you put in some cleaning! I used to love red robin, but this was beyond disgusting.

You know, I would rarely give a chain place four stars, but everything was really yummy. Bacon cheeseburger, beer, water, broccoli, and a chocolate shake. Only weird thing was that the server kept looking and talking to me instead of the whole table (I was there with my wife and daughter, so it was odd he didn't think to take their order first). Other than that, the service was good.

With just two stars, you may think I'm being harsh, but the last two times I was dragged here (yes, dragged by my kid) it has been a horrible experience at the hostess stand). I don't understand why they cannot figure out if they cannot seat a table of twelve right away, they can still seat tables of two, three, five, etc. and so on.   Last time I was there, there were several parties that were very large, I'm talking like 18-20. They made all of the smaller parties wait until they had room to seat the larger tables. Now, I'm no rocket restaurant-scientist, but there was room to seat the smaller groups right away. I hope they get this worked out because it's so frustrating. Pros:  My kid loves this place, new reward card is a great idea Cons: I don't like this place, not a fan of burgers, etc.  Way too loud, way too many BD parties, inept front of house hostesses that can't seat in-coming parties accordingly. Way too long of a wait to be seated when there's obviously open tables for smaller parties. Please get some new stuff on your menu for those who actually like good food.

Went there tonight for my sons 7th birthday. Had a waitress named Ashley. Now, mind you, the last time we went there the service was horrible. The food was horrible. It took over an hour to get drinks, let alone our food.  Tonight....Ashley was amazing. Funny and nice and very down to earth and talked to us like people. She was attentive to my son and absolutely wonderful. She really fixed my thoughts towards Red Robin for the positive again.  I did wave down her manager and let him know so. I think people like this should be noticed and thanked. So ashley, if you read this....thanks. From,  The black lab and german shepherd family
David is awesome! He's attentive, quick, and helpful, but most of all, really entertaining. He was the perfect combination of jokes and bringing food. Best Red Robin experience ever!

The worst experience I've ever had at a restaurant. We ordered our food and it took awhile but that was understandable because it was busy late on a Wednesday. Our waiter was off so a different one took our table over. Then I ordered a burger to go for my boyfriend when me and my friend were done eating. We waited 30 minutes with out our new waiter saying anything to us and then finally he asked how we were and I said fine just waiting for that other burger. And he walked away and walked passed us another 15 times with out saying anything and then 30 mins later he goes "oh this is what you're waiting for!?!? I was wondering why you kept looking at me" I D I O T! And he dropped the disgusting looking ice cold burger. On our table. Waste of money, waste of time. I'll never be back.
Not bad for a Sunday afternoon, not quite rush hour yet because we got here early. Also if you sit in the bar there is no wait. Just ordered our food, waitress is friendly.

I don't normally post and I am usually a very positive person but after the experience and service I received tonight at Red Robin I have to forewarn others before eating at this establishment. So I wanted to take my mom and 4 kids out to a fun, family friendly restaurant for dinner tonight. By the way it was far from it. We arrived and we were told it was a 15 min wait! Great!!!! They seat the 6 of us in a tiny half bench/half table that possibly normally would seat 4 people. We voiced are complaint that we wouldn't be able to fit here with our food as we were already practically sitting on top of each other so they worked something out and sat us elsewhere ( thank you) after ordering our food right away we waited  an additional 45 mins for it to arrive. One of the kids meals were mistakenly forgot about (oops we all make mistakes) all of our fries were very cold and brown looking a little shriveled like they sat for way too long! My moms fish was so cold and soggy the breeding was falling off I asked for my chicken burger to be cut in half it wasn't (no big deal, I'm an adult I'll wait for a knife and cut it myself) waiting on the server for 10 mins to ask if our food was good, I then complained he half assed listened mumbled I'll get a manager and walked away still no knife. Manager comes over with our kids meal and apologizes (thank you) I express my compliant he rolls his eyes asks what he can do and walks away. Gets my a knife, now it has sat for 20 mins definitely ice cold by now I asked for a fresh basket of fries as they were delivered old and cold he says no problem. He delivered the fries and walked away, I paid my bill on the kiosk and he walks back over about 10 mins later and says I was going to discount the bill but you have already paid....my response yes I did and I'm not looking for a discount I don't need one I came to dinner to eat and I paid for what I've ordered. He pulled up a chair and asked why I was so unhappy, I explained himself he then asked why I would want to eat there if I was unhappy. I explained I like to eat here, my family likes to eat here and we come here frequently as he can tell by my royalty card. Why am I explaining why I come eat here???? He then proceeds to tell me that I am very rude and he just recently won manager of the year? Ok, congratulations! Tonight the service and food was terrible and yes I complained about it. He then sat right across from me and told me he knew my problem? Ok, thank you! No he voiced that my problem was I am racist against Hispanics and that is what is wrong with me??? Wow! Totally stunned he just called me racist? Where did this come from? Why would he assume such thing when I simply complained about terrible food that was cold!? I'm contacting corporate and I hope that no one else gets treated the way I was tonight in front of my 4 children. My kids have no clue what he meant or what the word racism means! I'm literally in shock. Needless to say I won't be returning! I will go to red robin from now on only when we travel!
Never had a bad burger here.  Usually get the whiskey bbq burger with unlimited fries. They keep your drink glass full.  Servers are always attentive.

On a road trip I don't want to spend a lot of cash or eat another fast food meal. So red robin in redding, ca was the perfect choice. The food was typical, but the service in the bar was great. We found an empty hi top and the bus boy switched on the USC UCLA game for me. The waitress was super attentive without being over bearing. I'm pretty cheap, but felt compelled to leave her a 25% tip. The whole place ran well. If only the Trojans worked as well Together  as the red robin team.

We were just here celebrating my sons birthday. We had a large party. No problem for accommodations.  Food was good. Service was good. Thank you to the manager for letting us brig the DeLorean from Back to the Future. We will be back

We love this place for a family restaurant. Bottomless fries and really good ranch. Plus they give you a free birthday burger in your birthday month. You have the whole month to use it. A few time the food was not cooked properly but the management usually makes it up to you.

I love Red Robin! They have an amazing BLTA croissant and their burgers are killer. Best part? Fries are unlimited! And to top it off they're actually good! Which is almost becoming too much to ask for these days. I'm always looking for kid friendly places and Red Robin is one of the best. Great kids menu options, loud and friendly atmosphere, and free balloons.  Prices are actually good too! Walked out this time with two kids meals, two burgers, and two soft drinks for $37. The only thing is that the service is a hit or miss. But the food is ALWAYS good, which is the reason people can't stay away. :)

Stopped by for lunch and the blue cheese bacon burger was fresh, hot, juicy and cooked to order. Service was great, a little loud but given that it was extremely busy and there was a birthday party it was understandable. I will return again soon

Southern charm was  . A little on the cold side but the manager came out and gave us a discount.  Busy place so understandable. Glad he was so kind to discount. Overall very pleased with this burger while on my hunt for the bombest burg. I rate it #4 of 5, but the top 3 were very hard to compete with. So glad I started eating beef! Burgers for the win!
I am ALWAYS given the best service! The food is sooo good! Try changing your bun on your burger to the onion bun! I promise you will love it!

I love the atmosphere here. I ordered the BLTA with a side of Chicken Tortilla soup. Both were splended. Everything was fresh and the tortilla soup was very good and had a lot of melted cheese. (Yum for those cheese lovers) The fries (cut like steak fries) here are always good and seasoned well. I hear lots of people say you have to get the fries and I would have to agree. its a fun place to come with family or just friends. The waitress was very nice and checked on us a perfect amount of times. All in all a good experience. Even if you are not a burger eater there is plenty to choose from.

I have had lunch with friends twice in the last few weeks at RR. The food was ok. The waitress were overboard on the friendliness, and making sure that we had what we wanted, to the point they were rude. Interrupting our conversations with friendly chit chat about themselves or the food. The first waitress was in her third trimester. One family she told this was her third kid, another family came in she told them it was her fourth, and told them about her lactation nurse! While my friend was in a mist of a conversation, the waitress came up and rudely interrupted to take our order. I firmly stated to the waitress that we will order, after we look at the menu and then ask my friend to please finish what she was saying. The waitress interrupted again, to let use know that we could call her on the iPad thing, which I loathe. The second waitress was nice- just too friendly. Thought she was going to order for herself and join us for lunch!

I (attempted to) place a pick up order. After the phone ringing for a solid 2 minutes, it was answered and I was immediately placed on hold. I think that ringing for 2 minutes is unacceptable but probably wouldn't be as upset had I not been placed on hold immediately. I ended up hanging up and going elsewhere for my meal.

Very upset that the supposed bottomless fries are no  longer "bottomless" as advertised.  You cannot have a basket of fries prior to your burger coming out unless you pay for it.  Why not just restrict bottomless fries as your dessert only!  Ridiculous corporate decision along with the stupid new 15 dollar "specialty burgers.

Staff are a hit and miss here; sometimes they're great sometimes they are horrible. I recommend the sweet potato fries-- so delicious and the sauce they come with is the perfect asset. Great atmosphere to take the whole family. Food is usually good but I continue to see a steady price increase over the last year or so.

Stopped in late one night while on a driving trip to Portland.  There was no hostess there to greet us initially, so we sat in the bar. The food was ok at best - not bad, but nothing to write home about.  We did notice that the Mac and Cheese seemed to be simply pasta noodles covered with melted cheddar (no cheese sauce or anything like that).  For myself, I ordered one of the smaller plate burgers, which turned out to be ideal, given the time of night. What saves this review was the service.  Maybe because it was late, maybe because it was busy - but the waiter was very attentive and helpful when we asked about where in town offered a good breakfast.  This was much appreciated.
Predictable, good burgers, fries, good for kids too!

If you have PTSD, do NOT go here.  Otherwise, it's a fantastic chain restaurant! I have always been a fan of Red Robin, from their clucks and fries (with barbeque mayo, of course) to their Royal Red Robin burger.  It's not five-star, high-quality material, but it's tasty, and there's lots to choose from, even if you're not a big burger fan. This place is friggin' PACKED on most weekends, so have a back-up restaurant ready.  The staff has overall been very friendly and quick.  It's a fun, boisterous, bordering on insane atmosphere.  It will seriously give someone with PTSD a flashback, though.  Trust me. Also, if you're planning on a slice of Mile-High Mud Pie after your sandwich, be sure to share.  One slice can easily satisfy three women, it's that big and chocolatey...That doesn't sound right, does it?
I've already done a review at another locations. Food was consistent with the other locations. Friendly staff. Great place for large parties!

Red Robin is a good chain to eat at, the foods good and they have a large selection. There's not much on the menu that is healthy without modifications though, most everything is high in calories, sodium, and fat. So if you're trying to watch you're figure it's not the best place to go. You can get a simply grilled chicken burger or a salad minus the bad toppings if you want to heat healthy here. But otherwise the food is good, the service is good, and you get endless fries... So it's a pretty good choice to eat here if you're hungry.

Wanted a good burger tonight so we decided on Red Robin.  While driving over there I was thinking that there was something about the last trip there that turned me off so much that I had not been back in over a year but I couldn't remember exactly what it was.  So we went.  We got a table right away.  So far so good but that is where the good ended.  The service was very slow.  It took about 10 minutes before the server came over to get our drink order.  Then another 15 before she came back for our meal order.  We both ordered burgers.  The server did not ask how we wanted them prepared.  They came WELL-DONE.  Wish I had thought to say medium-rare.  The bottomless fries are a good selling feature.  It shouldn't be a problem that my plate came with half a dozen steak fries on it.  And it wouldn't have been if I could have gotten the advertised refill.  They never came!!!  The only thing that came in a timely manner was the check.  I was happy to get the experience behind me and move on so I paid and left.  Hopefully a year from now I will remember why we don't go there and steer clear.
love the burgers and bottomless fries although burger prices are high

This is a review on the bar inside the restaurant.  Went into the bar as a group and the service was terrible.  Bartender was also a waitress and we had to ask everytime we needed something.  food might be good but not a place to go to just have a drink.
Ate here while making a stop for the night in Redding. Pretty much like any other Red Robin. Reliable service, good food. All you can ask for after a long day of traveling.

Based on yelp reviews we finally decided to try Red Robin's hamburgers. Result: to die for and maybe to die from. Burgers come cooked two ways: cooked and not cooked. She had cooked, and I had not cooked. Hers had some pink and mine had some blood (just kidding somewhat). Result delicious. About $9 each plus beverages. Oh, they had a food ingredient menu on the table. Do not look at that. Example her Banzai burger: calories 1,033; fat 20g; salt 1922 mg; carbs 68.Basically your food intake is about one week's worth of the ugly stuff you are otherwise trying to avoid. Mine (salt) was off the chart. It is a place for the younger set. She handed me my drool cup and I had flash backs of another time. Put this place on your bucket list.
one waitress spoiled the whole experience the last few times we went there. she has dark circles under her eyes and greets you by saying what do you want to order?

Not bad food, but less than enthusiastic staff.   The food is typical for this genre of restaurant, a lot of deep fried choices (which are pretty hard to screw up no matter what your culinary skill), burgers, and sandwiches.  It all tasted fine and I actually really liked the steak fries.  Most impressive though was the root beer float, it was a real float with real root beer and not the overly sweet syrupy "mix" that a lot of places will trick you with. The wait staff were also hardly noteworthy.  My husband and I went there twice within a week and both times the staff was very clearly just there to get a pay check.  The second time we were seated near the drink station and through our whole dinner about four other waiters were hanging out in the drink station chatting while their tables sat unattended.  Our waiter stopped by once or twice to check on us and refill my husband's soda but it was clear he does not like his job. Lastly, I thought the baby carrier slings were perfect.  Our daughter was only a few weeks old when we went in to eat and taking her out of her carrier in a public place didn't appeal to me but the slings they set up next to the table to hold her carrier were the perfect height and allowed me to keep her close & comfortable while I ate both at a table and at a booth.

My first experience at any Red Robin.  Good Royal burger but...... AMAZING STEAK FRIES!  I don't even LIKE steak fries... I'm not really even a fan of FRIES!  But I got seconds, baby.  Make sure to dip them in the ranch. OH MY LORD!  Wonderful!   I miss them and hanker already...

I've been here twice. I really wanted to like this place as I have a bad burger addiction. Its not terrible but it just wasn't for me. Lots of different fixings but two dry overcooked "super well done" burgers after requesting medium well wasn't to my liking. The sauces available to dump on my burger to make up for the dryness was a good addition.
Good service, fast, decent food, and decent prices. It can get surprisingly busy and I had to wait to be seated, but it's a good place to go to for burgers, fries, etc.
Best service, every time. Sit in the bar section a few times and the employees will know your usual order and then some. Love this place.

What's not to love? There is something for everyone, whether you are a meat eater, vegetarian or have food allergies.. you can all eat together. I love their veggie burger options. Any beef burger can have the patty replaced with a veggie burger. It tastes so real, I took a bite and thought I got beef! My child has a severe peanut allergy, and this is one of the places I feel safe bringing her. You just have to tell the waiter, and they send the manager over to give you a list of foods you can have... they mark your ticket with PEANUT ALLERGY, and I've seen the manager hovering over the staff while they cook it. It is so nice, not having to worry about ripping out your epi-pen after you eat. :o) Oh, and the food is scrumptious, too!

Great place to sit down and have an awesome burger!!! The endless fries are a major plus!!! Great place for any occasion. It has a fun atmosphere, great staff and awesome food. It is always a good idea to order some fries right in the beginning and get them before your burger. If you want a great burger and awesome fries...this is the place to go.

There's nothing wrong with Red Robin, especially the Royal Red Robin Burger.  It's just hard to send someone to a chain when there are so many good local restaurants.  If you can find it and afford it, go to Cheesecakes Unlimited instead.  Or, the burger at Moonstone Bistro is possibly the best.

This place is great if your willing to be patient. its best in bigger groups(i suggest at least 4), that way you have people to talk to while you are waiting for the servers to stop spreading gossip through the other employees. the food is good and service is usually not worth complaining about.

Hands down the strangest restaurant experience I've had and, believe me, I've had some interesting service experiences. So we get to Red Robin after driving around town for about 30 minutes looking for somewhere to eat. We are taken back to our both and our waitress runs by and tells us she will be right back. She goes over, takes another tables order, and then comes back over to us. She takes our order and then walks off. Shortly after she comes back with drinks. My husband and I are sitting there chatting while we wait for our food when the waitress walks by and puts a basket of fries on the table.  "No one else wanted these, so hear ya go." Um... ok... A few minutes later I see the food get delivered to the table she took the order from before ours. Perfect, our food should be here soon. So we wait... And wait... About 15 minutes later, the server comes over to our table. "My manager will be here to talk to you in a minute." Turns out the kitchen has lost our ticket. No one is sure how this happened. See the manager agrees to comp half of our meal. Ok cool. He also tells us that they have moved our order to the front and our food should be out any minute. So we continue to wait. We are sitting back by the kitchen, so I am able to watch as food leaves the kitchen. I look at my husband and ask "Didn't he say they moved our ticket to the front? Cause there is a lot of food leaving the kitchen that isn't ours..." At this point we just have to laugh. An hour in and the only food we have scene is the basket of fries that no one else wanted. But our drinks stayed full and they didn't try to cover up the mistake. When we finally got our food it was nice and hot. And the same quality that we expect from Red Robin. So despite the wait, we had a good experience and I would definitely go back.

I'm normally a huge fan of Red Robin.  Every time (with the exception of the last time I was there which I chose not to review because I was giving them the benefit of a doubt but not this time) that I go to Red Robin the food is amazing and the service is outstanding, outgoing & so friendly.  Until today that is.  We went the day before my brothers birthday since I work the next day & wont be able to celebrate with him.  We waited and waited for a server to get things started and finally he comes over (plus size guy wearing jean shorts?? not what I wanna see when dining out) and takes our drink order.  Another long wait and he finally gets our food order.  We specifically asked for a side of mayo, ranch, honey mustard & for a basket of fries to start out with while we waited for the meal.  While waiting he gave refills to 3 members of our party but ignored myself and my brother.  My mom finally got annoyed and asked our server if we could have the fries we ordered and he took off we assumed to go get them.  We never even got them.  After a while a different server brought us our food but not the condiments we asked for (not his fault as he didn't take the order & he gave us better service in those few minutes than we got all night).  This second server was told it was my brothers birthday and even said my brother would be one of the next ones to be sung to, but you have to complete most of your meal before they come out I've noticed so we figured it'd be a while.  Well, my brother and I never got asked if we wanted refills.  My nephew asked for his honey mustard again but as before, it never arrived.  Then our server drops off the check.  Really?  Not going to ask if we want dessert?  Still no offer to refill our drinks?  I was actually wanting to get the red velvet cake for dessert but by this point I was pissed and so was my brother.  My mom suggested we were not giving a tip and I totally agreed.  The worst service I've ever gotten at a restaurant.  I was a server at one time and never would I dream of disappearing and not offering to refill drinks or get more fries or offer dessert or not work that tip as much as I could with excellent service.  This guy was atrocious.  We complained to the gal that finally collected our check after ten minutes of waiting and my brother finally just leaving before he started a scene.  She brought a manager over and she was very wonderful and handled everything as she should have.  I will be back because of that but if I get this gentleman as my server... I will either leave or ask for a new section.  It was supposed to be a fun and festive night but it got ruined by disgusting service.  I've seen some of the best servers in my life work there so I'm shocked.  Even the previous visit there with the female server that ignored us (we tipped her) was way better than him.  He seemed to get this whatever I'm done with you attitude half way through our visit.  We couldn't even complain about the cold fries because he was never around.  What a joke.  I love Red Robin and I totally recommend it to anyone, just... don't allow this to happen to you.  Speak up.  The managers are very visible and watching, but they cant know everything that's happening unless you say something.  That was our bad.

Favorite burger place: We left the fast food scene when we walked in to the Red Robin resturant for the first time years ago.. Now we go here at least once a month sometimes more often..There is always a fun and happy atmosphere. The menu changes often enough to keep our interest, yet our favorites are there... The food is always enjoyable and the servers great.. My favorite is the Santa Fe Burger and cherry pepsi .. A tip, get on their email mailing list..!
Everything on the plate was burned & they told me thats the way its sapose 2 B...I will never go back thier agin

My family and I come here for the burgers! Its simply delishious and we go often. I dont like how the service is different every time we go. Some servers are super nice and are on top of refills and fries but lately we have been getting terrible service. It was a monday we went for lunch and waited 15 minsutes before someone seated us, and we had a lady serving us and she was a little older than the rest. She never gave us a refill on my husbands coke and we had to basically beg her for more fries and napkins. I wish that all the servers are friendly all the time. My advice is, is if your tired of being a server, then find a different job because it effects the customers and the business!!

I actually had my first red robin experience not too long ago!  I was excited because I had grown up seeing red robin commercials!  Honestly I wasn't extremely impressed. A friend that went with me loved it and said it was the best burger she's ever had.  They give TONS of fries.  They are bottomless so they keep bringing them out! The fries were okay to me. For some reason they wouldn't hold salt on them. I put loads of salt and it just slides off.  Other than that, if you are into that style of food go for it! For me, I'm not a fan of too much greasy fatty foods.  Great service! Very friendly, awesome atmosphere!  Many of my friends love it here.

I decided to come back and try this again. Today is my sons 21st birthday and I know that he has always enjoyed coming here. Even if he also was getting a free birthday burger.. The burgers today were ordered slightly pink but not red. They came cooked to perfection today. My son enjoyed being sung happy birthday to and he even ordered his first legal drink in a restaurant.  We were impressed with not only quality food and drink, but excellent customer service. A nice change

I came here a little bit when I was in elementary school and high school and it was a great place to get grub so I went back when I was hungry for burgers and I was in town. I got take out once for my mom while she was at work and it took three times as long as their quoted 15 minutes. This would effect the rating more except I was sitting at the bar drinking so it wasn't so bad. Another reason it doesn't effect the rating so much is because I have had so many good experiences here. Most recently, I went here with some friends and my brother. I didn't get any drinks but I did get a little rowdy and a lot loud. Dropping F Bombs in a family establishment is completely understandable if you are angry at your party members. My burger was good and I really enjoyed my time here. Really this is a "pretty good" kinda place (service, food, price, atmosphere all well and dandy).

My boyfriend brought me here a couple of weeks ago and I was disgusted with the food. I have been here quite a few times hoping that it will get better but I have yet to be fully satisfied when leaving red robin. Its either the food or the service that are bad each time. Prior to this last visit the food was good and the service was bad. Bottomless frys have no meaning when your server never brings them to you. Especially after asking her 3 times to please bring them.  On the other hand, this last time I had good service.  My boyfriend and I each ordered the same chicken sandwhich. Mine was horrible. My boyfriend loved his but as I bit into mine I wanted to gag. Flavorless, cold freezer chicken is what they gave me between two buns. I thought it was just me being picky so I had my boyfriend try my sandwich.  He couldn't eat it either even though he just ate the same sandwich.  Why mine was so bad I couldn't tell you.  My server didn't really pay any attention to me not eating my sandwich and pushing it to the side. It took a random server who was nice enough to actually pay attention to our table to get any help. He brought the manager who offered to replace it but I was so grossed out I just had it taken off the bill. I didn't want anymore of their cold, nasty food. I won't be coming here again any time soon.
I wish they would deep clean the grease off the floors underneath the tables

We love Red Robin. This one was sadly disappointing. The wings were overlooked and the chips they sat on were soggy. Our meal took a little bit to come out but no too bad, maybe they were unusually busy for a Wednesday night. Then the food came and the kids loved their burgers, and fish. My sons kids salad was bigger than mine which I thought odd.  My Guacamole bacon burger was missing seasoning and the kids freckled fruit salad was awful, neither kid could eat it. The strawberries were mush and almost gone and is was floating in liquid. My 7 year old actually said, "this looks nothing like the picture or I wouldn't have gotten it." When we mentioned it to the waitress she just said yeah they use the strawberries from the lemonade so they all look like that. No mention of fixing the problem.  This is the second chain restaurant we've been disappointed in going through. Redding.
Very busy place it seems all the time.  Best place to grab a table is in the bar, much faster service too.  Burgers good, mixed drinks were strong.  Very noisy.

If you want a "Six dollar Burger" skip Carl's Jr. and head to Red Robin. You'll end up paying about the same as you would at CJ's and the food is WAY better. Plus, two words - endless fries. (Seriously, our last trip to CJ's resulted in the loss of nearly $20....for two people!) Red Robin burgers beat any fast food chain burger on any given day. (Except In-N-Out. Yeah...I'm one of those "shambling, frothing-at-the-mouth In-N-Out Burger fast-food zombies".) Sure, Red Robin is crowded. Sure, all the birthday songs are annoying. Sure, the service is hit or miss. But all in all, it's worth it. Besides the burgers I also highly recommend the BBQ Chicken Wrap.

Aside from the obvious environment setting and point that they try to get across here, they make good hamburgers.  What I usually get is the A.1. Peppercorn burger, it's a mouth party of flavor.  If your over 21, it's more comfortable to sit in the bar area, it's usually no more loud if not quieter than the rest of the restaurant.  Their only downfall at this place is that it seems like you have to pull teeth to get extra fries.  I usually order fries in advance because heaven knows they are impossible to make so they take forever here, yet half the time they don't make it in time, the last visit the fries finally came after we were paying the tab and that's with ordering them when you were asked for drinks!  Aside from that, the service is good and the waiting staff are generally friendly.

I really do like Red Robin...the food is good and the service is good too....what i don't care for is that when they say endless fries and then only bring you our 8 fries in your basket and then you have to stop them and ask for more....you know what they are endless so just bring me out a big basket of fries that way I can enjoy them with my meal and not have to stop my waiter and ask for more...win win

My Family and I visited last night 12/30/14, building cold food cold, service friendly, but inadequate no endless fries, had to ask for refill. Would not recommend Redding branch, lots of help standing around.

I have been to a Red Robin in the past close to where I live and it was good.  However this one, they had poor customer service. I understand and would make sense to have a policy which don't allow food from outside, but that does not give the individual the right to approach a potential customer in a rude manner.  I never got helped even though I told the lady I was actually waiting to get my order taken.
I love their salads, always can count on good food and good serivce.

This was the first Red Robin my wife and I ever went to. It was a novel experience then, but we have been to several Red Robins since then and have enjoyed each experience.       Yes, it's loud at times, but I have never had the problem mentioned by several reviewers about getting good service. I'm sure it's because we try our best to avoid the busiest times so the servers have more time to pay attention to the diners.       Sure it's a chain, but the food is consistently good no matter which one you go to. I particularly enjoy this one because we have been on the road a long time by the time we get there and it's good to relax, have a great meal and then finish our trip happy.       I gave this place a 4 star rating because it's difficult to justify paying $10 for a hamburger, no matter how good it is. Two people each having a hamburger, soft drinks and sharing an appetizer is over $30.

Red Robin is very kid friendly, which is great. The burgers are cooked to order which you son't normally see in big chains, and I love that. The fries are really good as well, snd endless! What more do you need to know!

We took our grandaughter here for dinner.  The place was packed.  We live in Red Bluff, but everyone kept telling us that this place is 'The Bomb'...that it is.  The never ending french fries tasted like plain ole frozen fries.  Even my grandaughter wouldn't eat them.  She loves Salmon, so she ordered a Salmon burger.  Smelled so fishy she couldn't/wouldn't eat it, so they comped us her meal.  I had clam chowder and bread...bread was a slice of pizza dough, minus any toppings-hmmm.  My husband had tortilla soup and salad...so, so!   Moral of story:  We will NEVER eat at a Red Robin restaurant again.
The food has always been good but the mix drinks have been consistently very weak in the past few months. If your gonna get a drink i recommend you get something they can't water down

Three stars.  It's a chain. Nevertheless, drop me off at Red Robin, where I can order a real hamburger, good fries, and a draft beer, and the meal will be served to me on a plate. You go down the street and eat at In-N-Out with the rest of the shambling, frothing-at-the-mouth In-N-Out Burger fast-food zombies.  Pick me up when you're done. Also:  Please don't go to chain restaurants to celebrate your goddamned birthday. Nobody wants to hear a bunch of spotty teens half-heartedly chant the chain-restaurant birthday song to your sorry ass. Nobody.  Can I get an "Amen, brotha!" from anyone on that?
Clearly the best red robin I have been to.... The service was absolutely fabulous which made us tip more than the usual amount... Foodwise it was very good too.. just like red robin standards...

We stopped here last night because, of course, we had to take a little break and watch the world series. Here's the deal.....$4.69 FOR A PINT OF NEWCASTLE!  Get real Red Robin!  That's highway robbery.  Sheeesh!

I took my kids out to eat here a few weeks ago. The burgers were great and the beer was cold. They have a pretty good selection on the menu and the people are very nice. It can get busy in there so the waiter or waitress can sometimes become preoccupied and forget to bring you a box for your left overs. I will visit this place again !
Great food, can be slow at times due to being busy, but the food is fantastic.  Great casual, sit down restaurant, that you won't be disappointed about.

The service is awesome and the food is really, really fresh. Once in a while you'll get a waitress who is having a bad day or accidently forgets about you... or maybe it's just my luck... but the restaurant as a whole is awesome. They even have a little game room for the kids to putt around in if you are waiting for a table.  They have a separate bar area, which I've never had the chance to enjoy because I'm usually with my kids. I heard they have a very strict and specific policy on mixed drinks, so you better just get a beer or don't expect anything super strong as far as mixed drinks go.
we always seem to have a pleasant experience when we come here. we usually order a burger and a wrap...always very good. the service is great too. we will be back

I know this is a chain restaurant, but in Redding they do it right. We were just there yesterday and got a free appetizer, all of our orders (party of six) were correct and brought out quickly and our waiter Bobby was on it! He refilled our drinks, brought us extra fries, and all around responded to our requests with friendly and quick service. I have been to a couple of other Red Robins around the state, none compare to the service at this location.

It's a great place to go, friendly staff, and great food.  One recommendation, don't go at the height of dinner or lunch hour, as parking is hard to find at these times.  It's not that they have a small lot, they are just that popular!

RED ROBIN is one of my favorite places to dine. I have been to many red robins in different locations  Pleasanton, Fremont,and now Redding. I have had some fun times in this place good food and drinks and I love the bottomless fries always hot and tasty. Funny story the other day I went with a group of friends and we had a long night of drinking the night before so we all showed up little hungover and hungry one of my friends was on her cell phone talking  and the conversation wasn't very pleasant who ever it was made her mad she had not noticed the waitress came up and asked if we were ready to order so she hung up and blurted damn you guys are    insert ( expletive )  irritating me. The waitress made a sad face and walked away. Then 5 minutes later a new waitress came over to take our order. She was gonna take over I guess the other waitress thought my friend was talking to her. Then we came to find out later on when leaving the person who took offense was the general manager filling in shifts they were short handed. My friend said sorry and told her that comment was not meant for her and we left.

The place is obnoxious and loud!  It's like a Chucky Cheese but with Hamburgers instead.  There aren't even any games to pass the time.  Anyway, they offer free refills and fries, but I can never get a server to bring them to me.  Go to Bartel's Giant Burger if you want a good burger.   I only gave this restaurant 2 stars because of their cocktails.  Those are yummy!

Went here for my mom's birthday.  She ordered a bacon cheese burger and asked for swiss instead of cheddar.  The waiter screwed up her order and had to take it back.  10 minute wait for them to fix the order but no comp.  Snarky waiter (think its part of their ambiance) didn't make things any better.  Blue cheese burger and Spicy burger were okay but not worth $10 each.  Endless fries... if you can get a waiter over to your table.  Would not recommend.

it's a chain and yes its loud but they have the best french onion soup in the world. i mean literally. Everything else is bah but that soup is devine. delish, delovely. I wish i had one close by just for that soup. Trying to find a good french onion has proven a difficulty for me.

This place is one of the best group/family restaurant's in redding i have had pretty much everything on there menu and have not been disappointed once, my 3 fav burgers are the Santa Fe burger, the 5 alarm burger and if you don't like spicy go with the blue ribbon burger its toped with blue cheese crumbles! the service here is always top notch i usually go with a big group and are food still comes out fast and are server is always on top of everything, you don't have to ask for refills they just bring em i go here at least 2-3 times a month and i don't think i will every get sick of it. and a hit for you guys if you want a free appetizer since there french fries are all you can eat just ask when you place your drink order if you can have some fries well you are deciding and they will bring em out at no charge just a little hit because there fries are to die for. so if you a good meal at a great price check out Red Robin

Excellent at what they do, but don't expect "pigs to fly."  Big, relatively greasy, paper-wrapped burgers overflowing with additions, maybe a little slow at times on the refills and additional baskets of fries, but usually the service is prompt and they put enough staff on for the dinner rush, too.  And yes, it's loud, even obnoxious - especially the birthday celebrations - and then there's the kitschy decor, and occasionally a red-furred mascot to contend with.  So, go to Red Robin if you're looking for a kid- and noise-friendly location with enough sports-bar fare  to satisfy Dad (and soups, salads, pastas, etc. for grandparents, and/or weight- or health-conscious moms) after the kids' soccer games, recitals, or other obligatory parental-appearance opportunities.  To paraphrase Denny Green, it is what you think it is - that is, if you look at the architecture, or the menu, or the staff, or most of the patrons.  As a patron of Red Robin restaurants over the past decade or so, my tastes (and my dietary restrictions) have evolved.  But there's good stuff I can eat on the menu, and they'll prepare anything else I ask just the way I ask, and my kids can have all the grease, starch, and sugar they want.  Seriously, what's not to love?

I went with my kids for a birthday.  It took forever to get a table for 5 people.  The waitress forgot part of our order.  Luckily the free refills of the sodas kept the kids happy, but the kids didn't eat much of their expensive burgers.
